title: How does the U.S. stack up on economic growth?
itags: Marketplace Morning Report for Friday, January 4, 2013
description: When it comes to economic growth, is the U.S. more like China or like Europe?
contentencoded:
It's quiz time on the Marketplace Morning Report. Stephan Richter, editor-in-chief of the online international affairs magazine The Globalist, brings us today's question: What percent did the U.S. grow annually, on average, over the last two decades?

Your choices:

a. Over 10 percent b. Over 6.5 percent c. 5 percent d. 2.5 percent

Click on the audio player above to hear the answer and learn more about economic growth rates around the world.
teaser: When it comes to economic growth, is the U.S. more like China or like Europe?
